channel.title: Bluegrass Radio Show
channel.description: The Bluegrass Preservation Society, Inc Radio Show. One hour of homegrown Appalachian Bluegrass Music, hosted by Ewell Ferguson and his Bluegrass Kitty Cats Cleopatra and Harley.
channel.itunes:author: Bluegrass Preservation Society, Inc.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bluegrass Presevation Society, Inc.
channel.itunes:summary: The Bluegrass Preservation Society, Inc Radio Show. One hour of homegrown Appalachian Bluegrass Music, hosted by Ewell Ferguson and his Bluegrass Kitty Cats Cleopatra and Harley.

item.title: BPS Radio Show #393
item.description: Here's another show folks! Me and Cleo and Harley have put together another goodun'. Cardiovascular Exercise has 4 great old-time bluegrass instrumentals. "Lady of the Lake" by the Boys From Indiana, "Leap Frog" by Curtis McPeake, "Cedar Grove" by Bill Clifton and "Billy In The Low Ground" by the Lilly Brothers. That'll get the sweat a'flowin and the blood a'pumpin. So come on in and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #392
item.description: This week folks we've got 3 songs by No One You Know. We've got one from Lester and Earl, one from Bobby Smith and the Boys from Shilo, one from the Dry Branch Fire Squad, one from J.E Mainer (this is a goodun' folks - it's called "Wild Cat Woman") and lots more for your listening pleasure. If you like old time bluegrass music then you are in the right place so come on in and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #391
item.description: The Jug Busters. That's right folks, the Jug Busters. That's the name of a group that Mr. Lloyd Duff of NC sent us some songs by and we've got a couple of 'em in this week's show. We've got "Uncle Norm's Tune" and "Ridin' On That New River Train". It's old time bluegrass at its best folks and you aughter come on in and enjoy the whole durn show! We've also got the Iron Mountain String Band and the Old Reliable String Band and Lester and Earl and Reno and Smiley just to drop a few names. So reach over there and push that button!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #390
item.description: Folks, the Bluegrass Preservation Society is dedicated to the preservation of old-time bluegrass music. Come on in and enjoy our one hour show. With the help of my two bluegrass kitty cats, Princess Cleopatra and Harley Davidson, we put on quite a show. Ralph Stanley, Flatt and Scruggs, Reno and Smiley, Uncle Dave Macon and many more are right here for your listening pleasure. So come on in and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #389
item.description: Howdy folks. This week we have found an old group we heard for the first time on Pandora. They are called the "Old Reliable String Band" and we've got our Classic dedicated to them this week. They perform "Boil Them Cabbage Down" and do a great job. We've also got Del McCrory and Bill Clifton and Curtis McPeake and J.E. Mainer and a whole lot of others. The songs will just keep coming at you: "Wrong Keyhole", "All Aboard", "When I Lay My Burdens Down" and "Good Hearted Woman" just to name a few. So, tune in, turn on and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #388
item.description: Howdy folks and welcome to this week's show. We've got music by Wade Mainer (brother of J.E. Mainer) including "Rubber Dolly" and "Speckled Top Shoes". We've got Flatt and Scruggs as well as Reno and Smiley. Then there's Mac Martin and the Dixie Travelers and The Vern Williams Band. If you like old time bluegrass music this is where you want to be.

item.title: BPS Radio Show #387
item.description: Bill Clifton, The Matheneys, Mama Corn, The Red Headed Express and Ralph Stanly and the Clinch Mountain Boys are just a few of the groups me and Cleo and Harley have picked out for you listening pleasure this week folks! There are some great old songs like "I'll Fly Away" by Big Possum Grin Bluegrass and "The Meadow Green" by Old and In The Gray. And we've picked out 4 great cardio vascular exercise songs: "Mandolin King Rag" and "Fire On The Mountain" and "Hard Times" and "Richmond Ruckus". Your sweat will be a flowing and your blood a pumping when you get done with them. So come on in and join us for some great old-time bluegrass music!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #386
item.description: Howdy folks. If you like old-time bluegrass music, you've come to the right place. This week we've got Mac Martin and the Dixie Travelers, The Vern Williams Band, Dr. Ralph Stanley, Mama Corn and a host of others. They're singing "Long Journey Home" and "There's Better Times A'comin" and "I Shall Not Be Moved". It's good stuff and me and Cleo and Harley want to invite you to come on in and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #385
item.description: This week is a special show folks. Earl Scruggs passed away this past week and me and Cleo and Harley are dedicating this show to his memory. We've picked out some great songs that he helped record back in 1945 to 1948 with Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys. Then we took the first album him and Lester made with the Foggy Mountain Boys and picked out some more. We hope you enjoy what we selected. Rest in peace Earl.

item.title: BPS Radio Show #384
item.description: All you folks out there who write me and Cleo and Harley requesting bluegrass gospel songs are in for a treat this week. That's right, we're playing bluegrass gospel the whole show. That'll give some of you a rest from cardiovascular exercise but the spirit will still get in you from all this great old-time bluegrass gospel music. We've got Lester and Earl, Allegheny Blue, Bill Clifton, Braxton County Bluegrass, Reno and Smiley and a lot of others. The music will lift your spirits and fill you up so come on in and enjoy!

item.title: BPS Radio Show #383
item.description: Doc Watson and Bill Monroe. Just the two of them, live on stage performing. We found the CD and we've got the music this week folks. "What Does The Deep Sea Say" and "Banks of the Ohio" and "Rabbit In The Log" are just a few of the jewels we've picked out for this week. We've also got Bill Clifton and The Highland Grass and The Vern Williams Band and lots of other good old-time bluegrass folks, but Doc and Bill sure do sound good together. So come on in and enjoy!
